title: Progress Indicator Pattern
excerpt: Providing visual feedback on task completion status.
content:
Progress indicators are UI elements that visualize the status of an ongoing process or task. They provide users with feedback about how much of a task has been completed and how much is left, helping to set expectations and reduce uncertainty.

Types of Progress Indicators

  • Linear progress bars: Show progress along a horizontal line
  • Circular progress indicators: Display progress in a circular format
  • Step indicators: Break down a process into discrete steps
  • Skeleton screens: Show a placeholder UI while content loads

Best Practices

  1. Accuracy: Ensure the indicator accurately represents the actual progress
  2. Responsiveness: Update the indicator in real-time as progress occurs
  3. Context: Provide additional information (e.g., percentage, time remaining) when appropriate
  4. Visibility: Make sure the indicator is easily noticeable
  5. Consistency: Use similar styles of progress indicators across your interface

Use Cases

  • File uploads and downloads
  • Multi-step forms or processes
  • Content loading
  • System updates or installations

Progress indicators are crucial for keeping users informed and engaged during processes that take time. They help reduce user frustration and uncertainty, leading to a better overall user experience.
